name: Path T
title: Pathological T
notes:
**Note 1**: TNM does not include a Tis or TX category for melanoma of mucosa of head and neck sites. Tis and TX are mapped to NA and TNM stage group is derived as NA.

**Note 2**: TNM does not include a T1 or T2 category for mucosal melanoma of head and neck sites.

**Note 3**: Assign T3 for extension involving the mucosa only of adjacent sites. Assign T4a or T4b for extension involving the deeper tissues of the primary or adjacent sites.

**Note 4**: Assign T3 for localized tumor when no other information is available.
rows:
In situ, intraepithelial, noninvasive

Unknown; extension not stated
Primary tumor cannot be assessed
Not documented in patient record

Tumor limited to the epithelium and/or submucosa 
(mucosal disease)

Tumor confined to mucosa of site of origin

Extension involving mucosa only of more than one subsite of supraglottis, glottis, or subglottis 
WITHOUT impairment of vocal cord mobility or fixation of larynx or NOS

Extension involving mucosa only of adjacent region(s) of larynx 
WITHOUT impairment of vocal cord mobility or fixation of larynx or NOS

Extension involving mucosa only of adjacent regions:
    Base of tongue
    Hypopharynx, NOS
    Pre-epiglottic tissues
    Postcricoid area
    Pyriform sinus
    Vallecula

Localized, NOS

Stated as T3

Tumor invades deep soft tissue, cartilage, bone
or overlying skin

Involvement of deep tissues of any structures in T3
Involvement of any structure in T3  WITH impaired vocal cord mobility
Involvement of any structures in T3 plus mucosal involvement 
Involvement of deep tissue or musculature of any structure in T3 WITH or WITHOUT vocal impairment or fixation of larynx or NOS
Soft tissue, NOS
Tumor limited to larynx WITH vocal cord fixation
    
Extension to/through:
    Cervical esophagus
    Cricoid cartilage
    Deep muscle of tongue
    Extrinsic (strap) muscles:
        Omohyoid
        Sternohyoid
        Sternothyroid
        Thyrohyoid
    Oropharynx
    Skin
    Soft tissues of neck
    Thyroid cartilage
    Thyroid gland
    Trachea

Stated as T4a

Tumor invades any of the following:
Brain
Dura
Skull base
Lower cranial nerves (IX, X, XI, XII)
Masticator space
Carotid artery
Prevertebral space
Mediastinal structures

Contiguous extension, including:
    Mediastinal structures

Stated as T4b
